name: 1. Basic crawl (default)
expectation: Should crawl example.com (no subpages). Returns 1 page with metadata. Tests: basic functionality, default parameters work.

name: 2. Restrict to child paths (crawlEntireDomain: false)
expectation: Should ONLY crawl URLs starting with /core/adaptive-crawling (e.g., /core/adaptive-crawling/sub). Should NOT crawl /advanced/, /api/, or / root. Tests: path restriction logic works.

name: 3. Crawl entire domain (crawlEntireDomain: true)
expectation: Should crawl ANY path on docs.crawl4ai.com (e.g., /core/, /advanced/, /api/). Tests: entire domain crawling works, not restricted to starting path.

name: 4. Include paths filter
expectation: Should ONLY crawl URLs matching /core/* pattern. Should NOT crawl /advanced/, /api/, etc. Tests: includePaths regex filter works.

name: 5. Exclude paths filter
expectation: Should crawl all paths EXCEPT /api/* and /advanced/*. Should crawl /core/, etc. Tests: excludePaths regex filter works.

name: 6. Include + Exclude paths combined
expectation: Should crawl /core/* paths but NOT /core/ask-ai. Tests: both filters work together, exclude takes precedence.

name: 7. Skip sitemap mode
expectation: Should NOT fetch sitemap.xml. Only discovers links from page HTML. Tests: sitemap mode works.

name: 8. Include sitemap mode (default)
expectation: Should fetch sitemap.xml URLs + page links. May have more URLs than skip mode. Tests: sitemap fetching works.

name: 9. Allow subdomains
expectation: Should crawl google.com AND www.google.com, maps.google.com, etc. Tests: subdomain crawling works.

name: 10. Disallow subdomains (default)
expectation: Should ONLY crawl www.google.com. Should NOT crawl maps.google.com or other subdomains. Tests: exact domain matching works.

name: 11. Ignore query parameters
expectation: URLs like /page?a=1 and /page?b=2 treated as same URL (/page). No duplicates. Tests: query param deduplication works.

name: 12. Keep query parameters (default)
expectation: URLs with different query params treated as different URLs. May have more pages than test 11. Tests: query params preserved.

name: 13. Max discovery depth (shallow)
expectation: Only crawls starting page + direct links (1 level deep). Tests: depth limit works.

name: 14. Max discovery depth (deep)
expectation: Crawls 3 levels deep (start → links → links → links). May find more pages than test 13. Tests: deeper crawling works.

name: 15. Multiple formats
expectation: Returns markdown, html, links[], images[] for each page. Tests: multiple output formats work.

name: 16. Screenshot format
expectation: Returns screenshot URL (uploaded to S3). No markdown/html. Tests: screenshot capture + S3 upload works.

name: 17. Only main content
expectation: Markdown excludes nav, header, footer, aside. Cleaner content. Tests: content filtering works.

name: 18. Custom exclude tags
expectation: Markdown excludes <table> and divs with class 'infobox'. Tests: custom tag exclusion works.

name: 19. Mobile mode
expectation: Screenshot uses mobile viewport (390x844) and mobile user agent. Tests: mobile emulation works.

name: 20. Custom headers
expectation: Page content shows X-Custom-Header in request headers. Tests: custom headers work.

name: 21. Wait before scrape
expectation: Waits 2 seconds before capturing content. Useful for JS-rendered pages. Tests: delay works.

name: 22. Custom timeout
expectation: Page has 60 seconds to load (instead of default 30s). Tests: custom timeout works.

name: 23. Location settings (German)
expectation: Page loads with German locale/timezone. May see German content. Tests: location settings work.

name: 24. Max concurrency
expectation: Crawls max 3 pages simultaneously. May be slower than higher concurrency. Tests: concurrency limit works.

name: 25. Delay between requests
expectation: Waits 1 second between each page crawl. Takes longer. Tests: delay/rate limiting works.

name: 26. Complex: Entire domain + filters + options
expectation: Crawls entire domain BUT only /core/* paths, 2 levels deep, clean content. Tests: multiple features work together correctly.
